history.content:
In COE, you can only do late grading option after you completed 20 units of upper division courses and must have at least 2 letter-grades technical courses in that semester. Also, you cannot do late grading option for required courses i.e. CS61 series, 70, or EE16A/B.

If you satisfy those requirements, you should make an appointment with your adviser to fill out a form and sign it. Your adviser has to sign it too. It will be due on Friday of the Dead Week.

In COE, you can only do late grading option after you completed 20 upper division courses and must have at least 2 letter-grades technical courses in that semester. Also, you cannot do late grading option for required courses i.e. CS61 series, 70, or EE16A/B.

If you satisfy those requirements, you should make an appointment with your adviser to fill out a form and sign it. Your adviser has to sign it too. It will be due on Friday of the Dead Week.

In COE, you can only do late grading option after you completed 20 upper division courses and must have at least 2 letter-grades technical courses in that semester.

If you satisfy those requirements, you should make an appointment with your adviser to fill out a form and sign it. Your adviser has to sign it too. It will be due on Friday of the Dead Week.

In COE, you can only do late grading option after you completed 20 upper division courses and must have at least 2 letter-grades technical courses in that semester.

If you satisfy those requirements, you should make an appointment with your adviser to fill out a form and sign it. Your adviser has to sign it too. It will be due by this Friday.
In COE, you can only do late grading option after you completed 20 upper division courses and must have at least 2 letter-grades technical courses in that semester.

children.subject: You only need to be in 2 technicals that count to your major thereafter, the 20 units of upper division units isn't a thing

history.content: The student responses and follow up all depend on what course you're trying to P/NP. You cannot P/NP a technical course (before or after the deadline) until you have completed all technical degree requirements. Schedule a meeting with your ESS Advisor or visit drop-in advising on Wednesday.
Does anyone have any experience with a late grading option change in CoE? Is it similar to L&S "one-time unconditional" policy?
history.subject: Late grading option change in CoE
